name: Provencal Tuna Melt
author: chpmnk42
summary: This isn't your standard greasy diner version of a tuna melt. Packed with lots of flavor, this makes for an excellent lunch.
ingredients: 1 (6 ounce) can olive-oil packed tuna, untrained
¼  red bell pepper, cut into 1/4-inch pieces
2 teaspoons capers, drained and coarsely chopped
1 teaspoon olive oil, or to taste
2 slices fresh Asiago, or more to taste
directions: Drain about 1/2 of the olive oil from the tuna
Scrape tuna and remaining oil into a mixing bowl
Add bell pepper, scallions, capers, and thyme
Add lemon juice, mayonnaise, and red pepper flakes
Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Lay bread slices crust-sides up on an unlined baking sheet
Broil until nicely browned, about 1 minute
Turn bread slices over with tongs and divide the tuna filling between 2 slices
Arrange Asiago cheese over the other two slices
Heat until cheese is bubbly and golden brown and filling is hot, about 2 minutes
Use tongs to turn the cheese-topped slices over on top of those spread with filling
Slice tuna melts in half and serve immediately
